A single displacement reaction occurs wi: Does copper react with ferrous sulfate? Copper ferrous sulfate reaction type
When you drop copper wire into ferrous sulphate solution, no reaction occurs because copper is less reactive than iron, and it cannot displace iron from the ferrous sulphate.
Does copper react with ferrous sulfate? Copper ferrous sulfate reaction type

Based on this information, we can predict that the products will be iron(II) sulfate (FeSO4) and solid copper (Cu). This reaction is also an example of a redox reaction, where iron is oxidized (loses electrons) and copper is reduced (gains electrons).
